intro: Conceveiba parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved Conceveiba, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
